article.headline: Hawaii 62, SMU 59
article.story: HONOLULU (AP) -- Michael Kuebler scored 21 points and Haim Shimonovich blocked a would-be game-tying 3-point shot as Hawaii rallied past Southern Methodist 62-59 Saturday night to reclaim first place in the Western Athletic Conference. The victory, coupled with a loss by Texas-El Paso, gave the Rainbow Warriors (17-5, 9-3) a half-game lead over the Miners for first place in the WAC. As time expired, Bryan Hopkins' 3-point shot hit the back of Shimonovich's arm. Earlier, Shimonovich blocked another attempt by the Mustangs with 12 seconds remaining that would have tied the game as well. The Mustangs used a 9-2 rally to cut the deficit to 54-52 with four minutes left. Hopkins' 4-point play with 1:13 left gave the Mustangs a 59-58 lead, but Kuebler hit a 3-pointer with 47 seconds remaining to put Hawaii up for good. Julian Sensley added 11 points and Jake Sottos had 10, all in the first half, for Hawaii. Hopkins led SMU (10-13, 4-9) with 16 points and Kris Lowe and Patrick Simpson scored 13 each.
